intro: Hymenatherum aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, hard pods that contain seeds. Hymenatherum aurantiacum is an important species in Australian ecosystems and is also a symbol of the country's natural heritage.
